Focus on field with property name Field79 (size 60 text field)
Focus on field with id Test123 (Date1 field)

bean.p:instructionalText: Take note of the constraintText text underneath field inputs, they describe the validation constraint for that field. Validation constraints are evaluated by default when a user leaves a field, if the user has not satisfied the requirement, the ui will alert them of their error. When they return to a field the ui will dynamically remove the error as they correct it and note any additional errors they may have caused.

bean.p:title: Progressive Disclosure and Conditional Refresh
bean.p:instructionalText: Fields and Groups (ONLY!) can have conditions in which they show themselves on the page or in which they refresh themselves. Refreshing is defined as requesting an new component from the server (which may or may not be the same element ui wise).

bean.p:title: Lookups, Inquiry, and SuggestBoxes inline
bean.p:instructionalText: Lookups and Inquiries backed by BO searches can be used on fields to fill in their values, as well as SuggestBoxes backed by a query
Lists of Data Objects

NOTE: ANYTHING seen in the following groups can also be applied to the page level as it is also a group. ErrorsField options are also available on AttributeFields.

property.name: title
property.value: Required constraint

property.name: instructionalText
property.value: An attribute field can be defined as required by setting its required property to true. Note required fields are marked with an asterisk.

bean.p:instructionalText: different text for required indicator
Interesting note is that radios and checkboxes will not check requiredness until a submit event, other constraints dealing with non-null values will still apply as normal
different required indicator location

property.name: title
property.value: PreRequisite constraint

property.name: instructionalText
property.value: When a field is filled out, it can require another field to be filled out as a result. This is called a PrerequisiteConstraint. Whether that field comes after or before that field is irrelevant, as the ui will only notify the user when appropriate. For example, if you havent yet visited a field that is now required, the user will only be notified of an error after they have first visited this now required field and have not filled it out. Alternatively, if the field that is now required comes before the field that requires it, the user will be notified immediately. These mechanisms are set up to prevent the ui from showing errors before the user had a chance to interact with the corresponding field within the overall page flow. A useful and common technique is to put a prerequisite constraint on both fields requiring eachother (example case: a measurement requires both a value and a unit, neither make sense without the other). A field can have any number of PrerequisiteConstraints in their dependencyConstraints property.

bean.p:label: Field A
bean.p:constraintText: Field A requires Field B and Field C

bean.p:label: Field B
bean.p:constraintText: Required when Field A has a value

bean.p:label: Field C
bean.p:instructionalText: try filling out this field first, and see differences in interaction
bean.p:constraintText: Required when Field A has a value, BUT also requires Field A to be filled out

property.name: title
property.value: MinMax length and value

property.name: instructionalText
property.value: You can set the min and max length of a field and the min and max value of a field. Min and Max value will only work properly on numeric value fields so it is also a good idea to require those types of characters only through a ValidCharactersConstraint on the field. These can be set directly through AttributeField's properties or through its SimpleConstraint bean. Note that min value is exclusive and max value is inclusive (as stated by their property names).

bean.p:label: MinMax Value test
bean.p:constraintText: Must be greater than 2 and no more than 50

property.name: instructionalText
property.value: Must Occurs constraint is used to identify fields that are required before this field can be filled out. This is different from prerequisite constraints because the number of fields required from a set of fields can be set, as well as alternative groups of fields that will satisfy the must occurs constraint. See examples below:

bean.p:label: Field With MustOccurs
bean.p:constraintText: Field 1A; OR Field 2A with Field 2B must occur when this field has a value

bean.p:label: Field With MustOccurs
bean.p:constraintText: Field 3A; OR Field 4A with Field 4B BUT NOT BOTH (ie all 3 fields filled in) must occur when this field has a value

bean.p:label: Field With MustOccurs
bean.p:constraintText: More complexity:(5A OR 5B) OR (6A AND 6B) is required by this field

property.name: instructionalText
property.value: A case constraint can make a constraint applicable only when a certain case is satisfied.

bean.p:label: Case Radio
bean.p:instructionalText: Chose an option to apply that constraint to the field, this is controlled by that field's CaseConstraint

bean.p:value: Make Field X Required and Allow only AlphaNumeric characters
Make Field Y allow values no greater than 500 and no more than 3 characters
Make Field Z1 require Field Z2

bean.p:label: Field 3
bean.p:instructionalText: When Field 1 has a value AND when Field 2 does not have the value A, this field is required

bean.p:label: Progressive Disclose options
bean.p:instructionalText: Chose an option to display the corresponding fields

bean.p:value: Show Field 1 - no ajax request, the content is already on the page but hidden
Show Field 2 - this will do an ajax request for the field the first time, then hide and show it locally
Show Field 3 - this will do an ajax request for the field each time the condition is met

email address
Url in http format
Accepts EVERY DateFormat set up in the system configuration, use allowedFormats property to limit (this must be a subset of allowed formats), see next field

Accepts some basic 12 hour time format
Accepts some basic 24(0-23) hour time format
Timestamp - under revamp
Valid years 1600s to 2000s only
any valid month number
any valid zipcode with or without -
alpha numeric characters only - no options on

bean.p:label: AlphaNumericPatternConstraint with Options
bean.p:instructionalText: alpha numeric characters with flags for whitespace, underscore, and forward slash on
alpha characters with flags for whitespace and commas on
alpha characters with flag for all "allowable" symbols turned on - | and ~ are not in this set, for example
anything with no whitespace allowed
only allow a set of characters - example allows a, b, c, A, B, or C
allows only numeric characters, allowParenthesis and allowDash on

bean.p:label: ValidCharactersConstraint - custom
bean.p:instructionalText: custom valid characters constraint - this one accepts only 1 alpha character followed by a period and then followed by a number (a.8, b.0, etc)
